Class ContactManagerUtilities

java.lang.Object
  ContactManagerUtilities

public class ContactManagerUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

An auxiliary class that handles much of the user interface of ContactManager, taking and validating user entries.

Method Detail

displayWelcome

public static void displayWelcome()
Displays welcome banner on screen.

chooseMainMenuOption

public static int chooseMainMenuOption()
Displays main menu of numerical choices.

Returns:
an integer for use in switch statement of ContactManagerRunner class.

validateOption

public static int validateOption(int min,
                                 int max)
A method that validates whether an integer is within a range of acceptable values for use with numerical option menus. I.e. if the range of menu choices is 1-8, this method ensures values outside of this range are caught as exceptions.

Parameters:
min - the minimum value acceptable.
max - the maximum value acceptable.
Returns:
a user-entered number representing a numerical option.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if a non-integer is entered.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a number outside of the specified range is entered.

selectAttendees

public static int[] selectAttendees(java.util.Set<Contact> contactList)
A method that allows the user to select multiple contacts by ID number. These numbers are added to an array, which is returned to the ContactManagerRunner class for use with ContactManager's getContacts(int... ids) method.

Parameters:
contactList - set, passed from ContactManager.
Returns:
array of integers representing user-selected contact IDs.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the IDs aren't entered in a comma-separated String (although there is some leniency with regard to comma spacing).

validateCommaString

public static boolean validateCommaString(java.lang.String userEntry)
A method to validate a user-entered String of digits separated by commas and spaces. Some degree of leniency with regard to spacing to ensure user-friendliness. I.e. 1,2,3 , 4, 5,6, 7 is considered valid.

Parameters:
userEntry - a user-entered String passed from selectAttendees().
Returns:
true or false (String is valid or invalid respectively).

createDateAndTime

public static java.util.Calendar createDateAndTime()
Creates a Calendar date and time from user input. Rules out invalid dates such as 29.02 outside of a leap year, and ensures that months with only 30 days cannot be assigned a date of 31. Rules out invalid times such as 25:79.

Returns:
Calendar object with user-determined date and time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the date or time is invalid, in terms of format and value (i.e. time not in 24-hour hh:mm format, or outside of valid range).

createDate

public static java.util.Calendar createDate()
Creates a Calendar object without a user-specified time. Useful for looking up meetings by date only (without regard to time).

Returns:
a user-determined date.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the date is invalid (i.e. 29th Feb outside of a leap year), and also if the format is invalid (not in dd.mm.yyyy format, although there is some leniency i.e. d.m.yyyy where possible).

validateDateEntry

public static boolean validateDateEntry(java.lang.String userEntry)
Validates user-entered dates. Accepts dates in dd.mm.yyyy format, with leniency for d.m.yyyy where possible i.e. 1.2.2013. Also validates that day values do not exceed 31, and that month values do not exceed 12.

Parameters:
userEntry - a user-entered String, passed from other methods or classes for validation.
Returns:
true or false depending on whether the String is considered valid or not.

validateTimeEntry

public static boolean validateTimeEntry(java.lang.String userEntry)
Validates user-entered times. Checks time format, allowing hh:mm / h:mm / hh.mm / h.mm. Rules out invalid times such as 25:99.

Parameters:
userEntry - a user-entered String, passed from other methods for validation.
Returns:
true or false depending on whether the String is considered valid or not.

lookUpMeetingOptions

public static int lookUpMeetingOptions()
A sub-menu with numerical options for selecting how to search for a meeting.

Returns:
an int for use in switch statement of ContactManager.

searchByContactOptions

public static int searchByContactOptions()
A sub-menu with numerical options for selecting how to search for a meeting by Contact (ID or name).

Returns:
an int for use in switch statement of ContactManagerRunner.

printMeetingDetails

public static void printMeetingDetails(Meeting meeting)
Prints the details (date, time, ID, attendees) of a meeting. If the meeting is an instance of PastMeeting, it also prints the meeting notes.

Parameters:
meeting - the meeting about which details are to be printed.

validateNumber

public static int validateNumber(java.lang.String entry)
A method to validate that user input can be interpreted as an int.

Parameters:
entry - a String entered by the user, pending conversion to int.
Returns:
the user-entered String parsed to an int.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the parameter String consists of anything other than numbers.

printMeetingList

public static void printMeetingList(java.util.List<? extends Meeting> list)
A method to print lists containing Meetings (and subtypes).

Parameters:
list - a list of type Meeting (or subtype).

lookUpContactOptions

public static int lookUpContactOptions()
A sub-menu with numerical options for selecting how to search for a contact.

Returns:
an int for use in switch statement of ContactManagerRunner.

displayContactList

public static void displayContactList(java.util.Set<Contact> contactList)
Displays contact list on screen.

Parameters:
contactList - contact set from ContactManager.

renderTime

public static java.lang.String renderTime(java.util.Calendar date)
Renders time fit for display on screen.

Parameters:
date - the Calendar object whose value is to be printed on screen.
Returns:
a String, showing the time in a user-friendly format.

renderDate

public static java.lang.String renderDate(java.util.Calendar date)
Renders date fit for display on screen.

Parameters:
date - the Calendar object whose value is to be printed on screen.
Returns:
a String, showing the date in a user-friendly format.
